Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Bekon i czekolada. Mhhnghh.

Nose shows subtle, coffee, a bit of chocolate, very subtle smoke and light grassy hops.

Delving deep in the cellar I came across this and decided to share it one evening. The bottle called it "Rauch Geek" but it was fairly apparent what to expect based on Mikkellers reputation. This one hits a home run and its only drawback is that it might break the budget to keep too much around.

Aroma / Appearance - A fluid black base builds from waves of icy legs. Smoky bacon bits, coffee, and dry bitterness engulf the air as if you were walking into a diner during the peak of breakfast. Dark fruits underscore the richness.

Flavor / Palate - Malty coffee, bacon soaked in ash, and more meatiness than any beer has the right to possess dominate the profile. The richness permeates the palate so well that it takes a long time to fade. If you are tired of super high gravity offerings or experimental sours track down a Beer Geek and find out for yourself why they remain one of the best in the world.

The Smoked variant of Beer Geek Breakfast takes the hugely malty and chocolaty framework and adds some smoky umami to the mix. Meaty, roasty, chocolaty characteristics in the aromatics and flavor. Rich texture but its balanced by an earthy, smoky bitterness. This is one very tasty dark brown beer with some pleasant savory and coffee notes.
Smoky smell, bacon, sausage, oat, cocoa and coffee. Flavor is smoke and its astringently bitter. A full mouthful. Harsh and very dark.

Draft.

A- Light smoke, light chocolate.

A- Black color, dark liquid, tan head.

T- Smoke, subtle umami, tobacco, leather, roasty.

P- Full body, average texture, average carbonation, roasty finish.

O- Not much bacon or coffee, both of which I wanted a lot of. That said, it wasnt bad at all. Well balanced and no single flavor was overpowering. More smoked umami flavor and more coffee and this would really be divine.
Salty bacon, hints of fish, sweet rich coffee, dates, honey, aggressive medium roasted smoked bitterness, roasty oat light sweetness

Pour: Oil black with a nice chocolate head. Carbonation maintains plenty through. 
Aroma: Wood, Uncooked Ham, Pine, Tobacco, Earth
Taste: Raw Bacon, Firewood, Roasted Coffee, Animal Fat, Oil, Light Oak
Drinkability: 3 out of 5, a little more ABV and I think I would really like this.

I love beers that push the boundary of what we think a beer is. Keep up the good work.
Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Aarhus. Blackish pour with a small tan head. Notes of light smoke, some peat, coffee, medium bitter, light savoury bacon and some light chocolate.
How: tap Appearance: dark brown with a small light brown head. Aroma: spice, smoked meat, coffee, caramel. Palate: medium body, average to low carbonation.

Pours a near black color with a khaki head. Smoked malt, caramel, toffee, coffee, nut, roasty malt and light meat aroma and flavors. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Coffee, roasted malt and smokey finish. On tap at Mikkeller Bar SF.

Tapped at Mikkeller Brewing in San Diego. Pitch black color. Beige thick head. Awesome rauch bacon smoked meat and spicy aroma. Taste is light sweet dark chocolate, espresso, dark fruits. Bitter hops and dark chocolate finish. Very good!

Pours dark brown with light beige head. Aroma is sweet, smoky, dusty, some cream, cherries, light coffee, oil. Taste is creamy, sweet, a bit bitter, soft oil, coffee, light bacon, dark chocolate, cocoa, butter cream. Oily and coffee aftertaste. Nice beer.
330ml bottle pours out black topped with a small tan head. Nose is big smoke roast malts cured meat and ashtray. Taste is more of the heavy smoke roast malts bacon meat big smoke.

330 ml bottle. Deep dark colour with long lasting head off. Aroma of coffee, notes of smoked bacon. Taste of chocolate, dark malt, nuts, in finish notes of bacon and coffee bitterness.Feeling of higher % of alcohol. Great one.

Tasted from bottle. Pours black with a beige head. Aroma is huge smoked bacon, campfire, coffee. Taste is moderately sweet with a mild bitterness. Flavors of bacon and smoked meats, coffee, maple syrup. Really nice smoked beer.

Bottle sample at a Mikkeller tasting at Beer and Beyond, Tel Aviv. As Mikkeller Rauch Geek Breakfast. Opaque black with brown head. The aroma has lots of coffee, some smokiness, hint of socks, roasted malt and dark chocolate. Bitterish flavor with notes of smoke, dark chocolate, coffee, light sweetness, a bit alcoholic. Oily texture, medium to full-bodied. Nice.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer and Beyond shop. Deep brown black with a small head. Roasted barley, coffee and smoked bacon aroma, nice but not overwhelming.Sweet, flavors of coffee, smoked meat, roasted, cocoa, prunes, mild sourness. Full-bodied, oily, low carbonation. Good.

Bottle. Pours a jet black beer with a small ring of tanned head on top. Aroma is rather smokey, syrupy and bacon, some molasses in there as well. Flavor is odd, a bit sweet and a bit salty even. Must be the bacon. Maybe even bittersweet, not sure though. Rather thick, full bodied malty experience with roasty characters. Aftertaste is long and sweet with overtones of smoke. A bit weird, but very nice!!

Tap at Mikkeller Bangkok. Poured a clear dark brown with a thin broken off white head. The aroma is powerful smoke, light sweet malt. The flavour is moderate liqourice bitter with a smooth smoky malt, light medicinal hop, liqourice bitter palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Dark brown color with a moderate, brown colored head. Smoke and dark brown sugar come to mind with the first sniff. Glazed ham, maple bacon, and waffles join in after. Thick and smooth feel, not quite chewy , but close. Start out a bit medicinal. A liquid smoke quality, that has some really strong coffee backing it up. Actually a bit too much flavor. A condensed can (bottle) of coffee and smoke. I actually like it for that reason, but enjoy it less for that same reason. 4/10

Draught at Mikkeller San Diego, 21.4.16. Black with a tan head. Initially chocolate milk aroma, and then sausage smokiness and then dyacetil. Very mild smokiness, dyacetil and then hoppy bitterness. Full body, chocolatey bitter finish.

Bottle @ Crazy Casorate. marrone intenso, opalescente, schiuma beige intensa , quasi marrone, minimale, e di breve persistenza. aroma complesso, piuttosto intenso, tostato, di cacao amaro e caffè, affumicato, di brace e prosciutto arrosto. Speziato come di chiodo di garofano. Gusto abboccato, acidulo, con note di caffè e lievemente sapido. amaro da tostatura e luppolo presente ma non prevaricante. corpo pieno, oleosa nella struttura, mediamente calda, rotonda, equilibrata. piuttosto armonica.

This bottled brew from a bottle shop poured a extremely small sized head of foamy finely sized bright clear colored bubbles that were very quickly diminishing and left behind a opaque dark black brown colored body and a fair lacing. The nice aroma was smoky and dark malt. The mouth feel was tingly at the start and at the finish with a bitter dark malt aftertaste. The yummy flavor contained notes of roasted malt smoky wood vinous toasted malt brown malt dark malt and bread dough. Delicious and one I would certainly buy again.

Massive chunks of sediment, not very appealing. Jet black with little tan head. Light smokiness on a milky oatmeal stout. Balanced and really smooth. Thick bitter chocolate and dry coffee bitterness. Really fantastic. A great recipe for a smoky stout. Bacon is perhaps a stretch, even the smokiness is really tame compared to a rauchbier, but I have a feeling it would pair well with some bacon and maple syrup smothered pancakes. Next time..

Bottle at World Wine Gallery, dark black thick liquid with medium tan head.Aroma of malt, coffee, bacon, smoked malt, caramel, prunes. Taste is malty, smoky, nice balanced with notes of caramel and coffee.Long hoppy bitter finish
Sehr originell da hat er es wieder geschafft. Erinnert an Speckbrot. Sehr dunkel. Aroma ist einfach fabelhaft. Wer geräuchertes liebt ist genau hier richtig.

Bottle from Brewdog online shop, drunk 16th June 2011. Very deep brown with a tan head. Nose and flavour have very smoky crispy bacon and strong roasted notes. Palate is a bit oily but not too much and strength is well hidden. Coats the tongue perfectly.

sample from bottle, shared in gotenborg sweden, deep black coloured pour with a small tanned head. nose of light smoked salte, salty licorice, deep dark chocolate, strong espresso notes, meat, and pepper spice. pretty weird combination, but interesting

Birra che inizia benissimo e finisce malissimo. Laspetto è bello, se non fosse per eccessivi lieviti in sospensione. Al naso è veramente molto gradevole, con sentori di affumicato (speck), cacao, caffè, liquirizia. In bocca inizia con questi sentori, ma da subito viene anche un amaro tra lerbaceo e il troppo tostato che stona un po con il resto e che soprattutto lascia una cattiva sensazione in bocca. Peccato!

Bottle. Pours is dark with thick brown head. Aroma of smoked malts, dark chocolate, smoked cheese, bacon, light coffee, cigar, tobacco. Taste is light sweet, light to moderate bitter, coffee bitter. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation, long coffee bittery finish. Overally very well ballanced, just the right amount of smokey notes, not very tarty, alcohol well hidden.

341ml Bottle from Parker Pie. Aroma: as expected lots of bacon in the nose, roasted malt and coffee. App: pitch dark, small brown head little retention. Taste and palate: medium to full body, smooth, loads of bacon and roasted toast in mouth, medium dry bitter finish. Overall: not my favorite style but this is a good smoked beer. Well blended with coffee. Way better warmer.
Yeah, so this is really good. Smokey darkey goodness. Creamy beige head, black body. Not my type of beer but thoroughly enjoyed.

330 ml bottle from Gallaghers Beer World/El Irlandés. Pours a very dark, jet black color with a small but dense, creamy khakhi head that lingers as a 2mm. film. Aroma is intensely smokey even when cold. Notes of bacon, peat, roast beef, pork sausages, Wagyu jerky and beechwood. Secondary notes come from coffee, tabacco, cigar smoke, licorice and pure cacao. Smokiness dominates and overwhelms the rest though it still smells somewhat stouty. After warming, you get more coffee character. Fantastic! Taste is strong, bold and powerfully smokey. Roasty bitterness, with sweetness attenuated and replaced by loads of burnt flavors. Quite a lot of coffee flavors towards the finish. Some cacao and dark bitter chocolate nuances. Not extremely complex, but two-faced and characterful with the smoke-coffee combination. Smooth, creamy texture, big body. The oats are clear in the mouthfeel. Smokey aftertaste as its logical. Same aftertaste as after eating BBQed tenderloin. Overall this is a great, vehement Smoked Stout that should help anyone in need of a smoke-fix.

Bottle. Pitch colour and brown head, moderate duration. Aroma quite strong hoppiness in the first moment, then phenolic and herbal character appears, not unsimillar to our local herbal liquor Demänovka. Rich and complex with hops definitely playing a key role here. The rich maltiness is balanced by it to give a rather bitter impression without being overly roasty. Malty side is more focused on smokiness, which in turn also is not overpowering, but soft. Easy drinking and well attenuated. The strange phenolish character is present also, may come from strange hops selection. Gives Demänovka impression, which is not something all would appreciate, but I do. Clean coffee flavour appears in late late finish, after you thought everything is already going away. Complex and rewarding brew.

Jet black pour with an espresso head. Aroma of smoked meats. A little dankness and some campfire. Huge, full mouth. Super bitter, very dry finish. Tons of bitter roasted grains. A little dark chocolate and hints of smoke. A lot going on and it doesnt completely go together. Lace present.

33cl bottle, served in Snifter. Pours black with small tan head. Aroma is smoke, coffee, chocolate and biscuit. The flavour has the same elements, and the first sip is almost bacon-like. After that, the thing is more or less as described above. The palate is mostly coffee bitterness and heavy dark malts. Full mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Very nice smoked beer.

Bottle from cervezalandia maybe? Color is super dark. Head is thin and beige. Body is medium. Taste is light salty, light to medium sweet, medium bitter. Aroma is nutty, smoke, meat, salt, pepper, coffee. Quite strange but interesting.

Bottle. Pours a jet black body with a dark tanned, medium sized head. Lovely aroma of smoked malts, roasted malts, caramel and coffee. Taste is moderate bitter with rich roasty flavor. Smoked malts mix in making for a fairly complex taste. Lingering dark roasted coffee notes. Different from the original alltho it has alot of the same qualities as well. Medium body and soft to avg co2 levels.

Bottle at home. Pours black, brown head that dissipates quickly. Aroma is smoke, salty, hints of bacon and ham, faint cocoa and coffee. Smells interesting! Definitely get the bacon and smoke. Taste is cocoa, smoke, a bit of salt and cured meat. Black coffee on the back end. Like an unhealthy breakfast in a glass. A bit weird but enjoyable! Medium body, medium carbonation. Glad I got to try this! Thanks Grant!

Oily black beer with beige small head. Aroma has oat, roasted malts, espresso coffee and some dark chocolate. Taste has lots of coffee, oats and roasted malts. Some smoky flavor but not that much. Smooth thick mouth feel and medium carbonation. I thought of more smoked flavour from this one, but the coffee saved this beer.

Aroma: coffee, roasted, dry plum, smoked ham. Appearance: frothy head, brown, lasting foam. Clear black liquid. Taste: medium sour, medium bitter. Palate: full body, oily texture, soft carbonisation, long bitter finish.
Black liquid with chocolate head. Aroma of bacon, pigsty, dried plum. Taste: pigsty, roasty, light sweer, medium bitter, light sour. Full body, oily feel, soft carb, long bitter finish

2015/10/11 - Pours a jet black colour with a thin soapy, tan head that quickly dissipates. Aroma in smoke, licorice, coffee roast, chocolate, oats, woody notes and a hint of vanilla. Taste is more smoke, roast, dark chocolate and oats. Slightly sweet and moderately bitter. Mouthfeel in thin to medium and oily with a long salty, bitter finish. Nice breakfast beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A Mikkeller Beer Geek sorozatának füstös hangulatú tagja kólaszínű testet ölt egy hamar tovatűnő bézs színű habkalappal, mely alól kezdetben szertelen módon, kissé rendezetlenül törnek elő a füsttel borított, erjedt gyümölcsökkel is megpakolt széntárolóból kiáradó hangulatok, majd a levegővel történő keveredés jótékony hatásaként kisimulnak az illatjegyek, megnyugszanak a pár perce még zabolázhatatlannak hitt komponensek, s egy tőzeges, óhatatlanul is sült szalonnás képet körvonalazó aromaszerkezet tárul elénk. A füstösség jellege élelmiszer-ipari kereteket ölt, avatatlan érzékszervek a legkevésbé gondolnak sörre az ízlelgetés percei során, nehéz étkezések hozzávalói elevenednek meg lelki szemeink előtt. A füstös aromák mérsékelten testes szerkezetben kelnek aztán új életre, átlényegült formában lehet szerencsénk a fanyar és sós komponensek orvosságos-tőzeges pörköltségű játékához. A fekete, kávés hangulatok persze mindvégig ott ólálkodnak a környéken, az olajos burkolat így sötét, ám sziporkázó tartalmat ölel keblére. Izgalmas karakter, melynek specialitása a sokadik korty ellenére sem válik nyomasztóvá, jól kifaragott modora mindvégig fenntartja az érdeklődésünket.

Purchased Friday, September 25, 2015 and enjoyed Thursday, October 8, 2015 in a Hopslam tulip/snifter. 

Look - Dark brown with slight red tinge. Very small tan head. The head is more of the sediment dripping from the glass. It was a very aggressive pour. There is no lacing. It is a dead beer but nice body color.

Smell - Smoked. Bacon. Coffee. Chocolate. Raw meat. Dark fruit.

Taste - Smoke. Bacon. Chocolate. Coffee. To tell you the truth it has a terrible after taste... raw meat. 

Feel - Creamy. Heavy. Viscous. Very nice for abv. 

Overall - I like stouts and smoked beers. This is not my favorite. It has a nice color and feel.

330 ml bottle at SBWF15. Black with dark tan head. Aroma is very roasty, smoked, burnt and woody with some chocolate and coffee. Taste is dry, burnt, roasted, smoked, some meats, bitter chocolate and more coffee. Dry smokey coffee finish. Not my cup of tea
Bottled. Pours pitch black with a small brown head. Smells and tastes smoked meat, salty, roasted malt with a salty mild bitter finish.
Bottle from Willow Market in Menlo Park, CA. Big smoky nose along with rich coffee, smoked meat candies. Taste is acidic coffee with smoked beefy bits. Massive things for breakfast here.

330 ml bottle. (Uba ja Humal) Tallinn, Estonia.
Dark brown color with a small tan head. 
Roasted malt, smoke, saltiness and some bacony notes in the aroma. 
The flavor is roasted malt, licorice, coffee, mild bitterness, smoke and some salty notes. Wow! Very rich. Liquid breakfast.

Black pour with a decent mocha head. Prominent smoky nose reminiscent of bacon or a smoked ham along with some toasted notes, some roast, maybe some dark chocolate. Somewhat sweet, decently bitter. Medium bodied, somewhat oily, rich with smoke that lingers and dries out the palate. A cool brew, definitely smoky.

Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. This inky black beer pours with a dark brown thin head of foam. It has an extremely roasted and smoky flavour, oak and smoked beechwood notes followed by chocolate, liquorice and smoky bacon on the bitter, iodine, dry finish.

330 mL bottle. Black pour, thin tan head. The bacon is present in the aroma along with smoke and more traditional stout characters like chocolate roast and some vanilla. Taste is wood, earth, bacon,. Oatmeal gives a nice smooth texture, mildly heavy body.
Shared bottle. Black colour. Smoky bacon aroma. Chocolate bacon flavour, full bodied, nice

33cl bottle from Uba & Humal, Tallinn. Clear black color. Small brown head, short lasting one. Quite dry palate. Dark chocolate malt, smoky and baconish. Acid and smoky bacon to ash flavors in the finish. Nice, but not quite the quality Im used to with M.

Bottle from Tanakaya. Pours a pitch black with a tiny brown head that dissipates fairly quickly. Aromas of freshly ground espresso, cacao, smoked ham with some light sourness on the nose. Taste is more of the same with the smokiness increasing as it warms up. Fairly light stout with some richness and the smoke is there, but isnt so overwhelming.
Aromat to palone słody sporo szynki (boczku) i troche czekolady. Słodki smak czekolady palone słody, boczek wędzonyi troche chmielu chmielu. Dobre

Bottle at mikkeller Sthlm 
Heavy smoke, Iight bitter, light coffee, medium sweet full body. Nice, but to heavy on the smoke to be great

BOTTLE 33 CL. Opaque black, small espresso head. The aroma starts with rich fruity sweetness and Franconian-style smoke, but also coffee, cocoa and some vanilla. Gradually, the smoke clears and leaves you with a classic coffee stout. The taste starts with lots of coffee, sweet vanilla and cocoa, and quite some smoke and charred wood. The finish is spicy hoppy. Just like the aroma, the taste gradually moves towards the classic Beer Geek Breakfast. Very good.

Botella. @El Lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo 07/08/2015 
Color negro, aroma ahumado malta, sabores ahumados tostado, cuerpo medio

Dun noir impénétrable, une fine mousse dépaisseur moyenne ne tient pas en place très longtemps. Étrangement, je reconnais des arômes sapparentant aux croustilles à saveur "all-dressed" ... et ce nest pas désagréable du tout. Des effluves de café sen mêlent timidement. La base chocolatée et torréfié est bien là en bouche, le fumé ajoutant une petite complexité bien nuancée et pas aliénante du tout. Pas mal du tout.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma is of bacon, smoke, wood, and toasted malt. Smells pretty good. Taste starts off with lots of oatmeal and wood, and then gives way to a nice smoke flavor. After a few sips, more bacon starts to come through. Lingering smoky bacon flavor. Has a strange sweetness to it, that I did not expect. Mouthfeel is creamy and goes down very easy. This drinks way easy. I liked it.

330 ml bottle. Dark Brown colour and head. Almost no foam. Roasted and smoked aromas. Thin and dry Mouthfill with coffee and smoked tast notes. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Black, tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, chocolate and believe or not - bacon (not sausages or ham - bacon). In taste it is a solid stout with nice roastiness and smoked bacon notes. Meidum bitter and roasty in the finish. Medium body, soft carbonation, smooth on the palate. Really nice beer.

Bottle. Stouty, with a smoky nose, mouth is relatively dry and silky, lotta bacon and the subtle salt adds a nice dimension. Kind of watery though for an imperial stout... although just drank this back to back with a hefty Icelandic motherfucker of a stout so its probably a little unfair to compare. Not a huge smoked beer fan but this is tasty. Just need some breakfast to wash down with it.

Taste from a 0,33l bottle from a friend. Pours very dark brown with no head. Aroma is roasted malts with some smoked ham. I guess you could call it bacon. Flavor is sweet roasted malts, chocolate, smoked bacon and some hops. Good.

Wow cant believe I can really smell and taste bacon here! Great smoky stout: classic appearance, black with thin brown head. Aroma is, well, bacon! Body is full and smooth, tastes of bacon and coffee, roasted malts. Great, great!

How: Bottle.
Where: Mogwai, Helsingborg.
Appearance: Black colour with a beige head.
Aroma: Roasted malt, smoke, chocolate.
Body: Full body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Coffee, smoke, roasted malt, chocolate.
Comment: A bit like a mild rauchbier.

Bottle is labeled beer geek rauch breakfast. Smokey and ham flavored. Nice oat and roasted malt backbone. Leaves a coffee ham smoke flavor in your mouth. Pours black with a thin reddish tan head 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Dark body, small tan head. Smoky aroma with some coffee. No bacon, just simple smoke. Taste has some nice coffee but its veiled by a cloud of branch burning smoke that doesnt belong in here. Again, a simple one-dimensional dry smoke character that in no way resembles juicy greasy mouth-watering bacon to me. I love the regular Beer Geek Breakfast, the Brunch Weasel one is one of my top stouts, I also love many smoked beers (most notably Schlenkerla) but this combination here is just wrong and the "bacon" claim is sorely misleading.
500ml bottle. Black color with beige brown head. Roasted malty aroma, coffee, smoked, bacon, light chocolate. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Bottle 33cl, a dark beer with medium brown head. Nose is on roasted malt and smoked notes. Aroma is intense on dark coffee, dry, quite smoked on the german way, black pepper notes, good complexity, nice dark malt notes and dry coffee. Well done
Medium head that quickly dissipated. Taste of moderately strong smoke, moderate Bitterness and roast, and not much coffee.

Pours deep black with thin brown head. Incredible bacon nose. Aromas are mainly roasted malts, smoked malts, coffee, with notes of black fruit. Low carbonation, thick texture. Long sweet coffee finish. Maybe a lack of bitterness. But excellent choice for tough morning anyway, just missing the eggs!!

0.33L bottle. Massive smoked and burned hop aroma. It is quite pleasant for a while. Really old diesel motor oil color with brown foam on top. Coffe, roasted bread, massive smoky, over roasted peanut, light caramel, roasted malt flavours. Very smoky finish, like burned wood. Wooah. What a feeling.

Bottled:Pours black with a small, weak head.Aroma is oatmeal, ash, char coal and just a hint of smoked ham.Fat mouth feel.Dry taste of ash, wood and char coal leaing to a unbalanced bitterness.Not one of Mikkellers greater moments.
Black with yellow head. Spicy alcohol, leather, licorice and chili. Metallic, smoked and medicinial finish. Overall: underwhelming.

Pours dark with low brown head
Aromas of smoke, bacon, tar, coffee, hints of chocolate
Taste has creamy caramel, bacon, smoke, ash, tar, soy, dark bread

Dark brown pour with medium sized tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate and smoke. Taste of roasted malts, smoky, chocolate, faint coffee, bitter hops. Medium bodied, medium carbonation, smoky dry finish. Was wanting a bacon taste but just a smoked stout. Pretty good though!

Black with stable, airy tan head. Smoky aroma, meat and charred wood. Mouthfeel starts of pretty big but finishes rather abruptly. Smoke and tar flavour, coffee but not much bacon though. Quite bitter, slightly sticky.

Pours very dense and very black and very opaque. Head is very dark and very scarce.
Aroma is very intense: smoke, chicory, soy sauce. And thats all: everything it has in intensity it lacks in variety.
Again, in the mouth it feels very dense, very creamy. Very fizzy, very bitter. Not very long finish.
Id like to say its very nice, but nonetheless its not very bad.

Bottle. Black colour with brown head that leaves lacing to the class.
Roasted malt, liquorice, chocolate, sweet smoke, smoked ham and meat on aroma.
Very smooth smoky meat on taste, with some chocolate, coffee and hops.
Smooth mouthfeel, medium+ bodied with soft carbonation.
Slight bitter, hoppy and dry, smoky finish.
Very "meaty" smoked stout.

Bottle. Black body with dark tan head. Aroma is roasted malts vanilla some smoke some coffee also hints of dried fruits. Taste is bitter roasted malts with coffee and some vanilla and smoke in the background. Aftertaste is roasted malts bitterness with malty sweetness and some coffee. Very nice.

330 ml bottle. Pours an opaque black with a small, chocolate brown head that laces. Roasted malt aroma with coffee, dark chocolate, liquorice and bacon. Sweet flavour of roasted malt, liquorice, dark chocolate, coffee and soy sauce with a dry, bitter, ashy finish. Medium body with a thick, oily texture and soft carbonation.

330ml bottle. pours a thick gloopy brownish black. aroma is dark chocolate, a little coffee but most importantly, bacon! bacon in the taste too. salty smoked bacon. roasted malts and burnt toast. bitter smoky finish.

Aroma: smoked ham, bacon, coffee and roasted malts, coffee.
Appearance: black color, thin beige head.
Taste: low bitterness, bacon, smoked notes, coffee, roasted malts, smooth, quite dry, ashy. 
Palate: full body (oily texture) and low carbonation, roasted finish.
Overall: Amazing beer, really complex and somehow strange taste, smooth and drinkable. Recommended.

Bottle from Mikkeller web shop. Smoky smell with dark malts, chocolate and coffee. Similar taste. More smoky then bacon ut I get what they where aiming for. More smoked ham rather then wood smoke or char. Not the best in the beer geek series.

330 ml bottle. Pours a ruby reddish black with a thick, creamy, resilient beige head. Aroma is salty, smoky, meaty and coffee. Flavor is coffee, roast, salty, meaty, mineral. Finish is slight mineral flavor, with hints of coffee bitterness. Lingering smoke and salt, with some bitterness. Medium to full body, average carbonation. Dark brown, almost black color, with a small beige-brown head. Aromas contain a lot of fresh crushed coffee beans, sweeter malts, bitter chocolate, cream and a decent amount of smoke.

Medium carbonation is responsible for the coffee to rush down the throat rapidly, while leaving a trace of smoky, roasted bitterness on the palate. This beer is defined by an interesting interplay of very bitter coffee and smoked, toffeeish malts, finished by a long acrid finish. Smoke actually doesnt have the biggest influence on the palate, but it is recognizable in an enjoyable interaction with the malts, adding an unusal flavor to this great beer. Arguing from the perspective of loving a typical Bamberg smoked beer, this smoked stout entirely lacks the characteristic hints of saltiness. It is even more astonishing that it doesnt need those, because of the complex coffee flavor, which stays in balance due to the malty smokiness - enough complexity is established in a different way, than they do it in Bamberg. The coffee flavor of this beer might already be enough to make this great, as it is very smooth, almost creamy, intense flavoured, and changes its taste on the palate during the tasting process.

UPDATED: JUL 18, 2014 Bottle:  "Rauch Geek Breakfast". Black body, with only a mild trace of dark brown outlining the edges; topped with a leathery tan head, creamy & slow to dissipate completely. Aroma have obvious smoke, with a mild peat & meaty aspect, a little like cooked sausage (or bacon, I guess). Faint wood chips with a mild, underlying sweetness, a hint of bitter cocoa beans, & some burnt, roasted malt in the finish. The tastes takes on more of a charred, campfire-like smoke presence with a balancing dark chocolate sweetness. Roasted malts & burnt wood play a big role, leading into a lingering smoky & black coffee ground finish. Smooth, slick body, coats the palate in the aftertaste. Very nice; heavy smoke presence, but what do you expect? Never becomes overbearing, though. I may like this one more than regular Beer Geek Breakfast, actually... But I am biased towards smoked beers.

12oz bottle, from Party Source. Pours a black color, with a nice thin darker brown head. Leaves good ridges of lace. Medium to bigger body, with a good chewiness. Crisp, light carbonation. Lightly dry finish. Nice smoke in the nose, with roast malt, coffee, and dark chocolate. Good smokey flavor, but it doesnt make me think bacon - probably a good thing. Smoke competes with a lot of big coffee in the flavor, which I really enjoy. Big bitter taste, little sweetness. A very sharp, bitter coffee stout. Smoke is not too over the top, well-balanced with the other components of beer geek. A real treat, that Ive wanted to try for a while. Exceeded expectations.

Bottle. Black with a thin tan head. No lacing. Aroma is lots of smoke with chocolate and a hint of coffee. Taste is still very smoky up front but showcases the coffee more. Light chocolate notes and hop bitternessin the finish. Palate is surprisingly thin with a lot of carbonation. Could go for it being a bit thicker. Intense.

Rauch geek breakfast. Again bottle thanks to Nick! Black thick pour with a small dark brown head. Smell is coffee, roasted malts, smoke, and bitter chocolate. Taste is again heavy coffee... Although this time the smoke cuts the intensity of the coffee. Roast, char, cocoa, and bacon. Less bitter than its counterpart. Nice thick mouth feel, good carbonation.

UPDATED: NOV 7, 2013 11.2oz bottle purchased from craftshack. Labeled as Rauch Geek Breakfast. Shared with Bob F. after work. Pours a rich black color with a finger of creamy dark tan head. Aroma of smokey roasted peat malt, chocolate, espresso rinds, and leather. Taste of smoked peat, roasted coffee, burnt toast, and bitter dark chocolate.

Bottle. Black colour with a beige head with minimal duration. aroma is roasted malts, notes of smoke, coffee and black chocolate. Flavor is roasty, light ripe fruit, light tobacco and ashes with coffee notes. The final is slightly bittery with medium duration.

Bottle with thanks to jtclockwork! Pours opaque black with a medium deep brown head, creamy with nice lacing. Aroma is roasty, chocolate, light smoke, tobacco, molasses - very rich. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. Very light smoke presence. Medium body, somewhat creamy. Finish is quite bitter.
Bottle listed at beer geek raush. Pours black with brown head. Aroma is bacon. Taste is all smoked malts.

Bottle to snifter (shared with the Mrs.). Looks good; a cloudy dark cola with foamy tan head. Smells solid; dark malt, dark chocolate, coffee, and smoke. Tastes like it smells with a solid mouthfeel. Good, not great.
Bottle from mikkeller and friends. Black color, fantastic brown head. Aroma is coffee, smoke (some bacon), licorice. Balanced roasty body, smoke, hops at the end, licorice, coffee.
roasted smokey maybe some bacon aroma. black beer big dark brown head. taste lis light sweetness light bitterness. full body, hick feel, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish.
On tap at Chmielarnia, Warsaw, Poland. A hint of smoke. Nice coffee aroma nd taste. Smooth. Very drinkable.
Smells very smoky. Like a good old barbeque. Has a black color with a nice thick brown bordeaux head. The taste is very smoked with notes of dark chocolate, coffee and whisky.

bottle from Bierkompass. Black, no head, aroma of roasted malts and lots of coffee. Flavours of coffee dominate, shy chocolatey hints, theres hardly any smoke flavours detectable. Because of the name I was looking forward to a very smoky beer - however, this was a very solid stout-like brew.
Bottle from Voldby. Deep Black colour with a Brown head. Smoky and roasted malt aroma with coffee notes. Distinct smoky taste. Hints of coffee, roasted malt. Nice smoky bitter finish.

Darkest black with treacley tan head. Greasy Applewood smoked creamy nose, Imperial and inviting. Bustling thick mouthfeel expands to a weird soapy clamouring greasiness. Silky and a little sickening. Finish is bacony and bitter coffee itch. Not as good as I remembered or it could have been. Bottle, Ninas Minimarket
Bottle. Pours dark with chocolate colored head. Aroma is smoked malts and meats, flavor is the same. Solid smoked/rauch, good mouth feel.
Tap @ Mikkeller & Friends, Köpenhamn 14/9. En riktigt god stout! Kaffe/kaffebönor i smaken. Ganska torr med en bra beska.

33 cl. bottle. Pitch black with a small, tanned head. Roasted aroma with smoke, malts, bacon (!), licorice and green, unripe coffee beans. Taste is bitter and hard roasted. Full body with a good, creamy texture - most be the oatmeal. Long lasting, roasted finish with bacon, light smoke and coffee. Actually, I wanted - and remembered in a sentimental manner - more bacon in this one when this beer was brewed by Nøgne Ø. Still a good smoker.

Bottle @ home... It pours pitch black with a medium tan head... the aroma is smoke, wood, bacon, salty and burnt malt.... the flavor is roasted malt, smoked, coffee beans, bread, salt and bacon... :) nice....

Color caoba oscuro casi negro. Espuma beigecde burbuja pequeña. Aromas ahumados ligeros y café. En boca es densa y sedosa con matices ahumados y un final amargo acafetado que va haciendose cada vez más seco y terroso. Rica.

660 ml bottle at home - 2010 vintage . Pours pitch black with a tiny lingering light marroon head. Nose of smoked meat (Schwartswald schinke), bacon, Ardbeg whisky, peat, hint of cinnamon. Fairly light body, a bit watry but smokiness comes through very well, slight bitter ending. Overwhelmingly smoky and toasty in the taste (coffee, raw smoked bacon). Lekker!

Pours a deep black with a brown head. Aroma of roasted malts and some smokey bacon but not very strong. Taste is coffe and roasted malts with a low bitter and softly smoked end. Very drinkable and not smoked as I expected for being part of the beer geek series. Nice!

Similar aroma to Aecht Schlenkerla Rauchbier Urbock but not as assertive. Pours black in the glass. Flavor of smoky bacon and roasted malt. Not as assertive as expected... Slight coffee aftertaste with a clean bitterness. Overall, delicious and very drinkable. Many humble thanks to BarZigKin for sharing!
Bottle. Very dark pour that looks a little thick. Reddish brown head. Nice smoke and slight meat aroma. Taste is similar but a little more subtle. Medium palate. Very nice.

Black with a brown head, smoke, wood, syrup, liquorice, in the aroma. Some carbonation, not as smoked as I was hoping for, lingering syropy sweetness. Decent, but far from being up to the standards that Lervig and Mikkeller have made imo. Needs more roast, oats pretty much dominate.

330ml bottle shared at home. Pours jet black with a thin tan head, lovely lacing, a treat to see moving around in a big glass. Aromas are coffee, liquorice, and supermarket own-brand Frazzles. Hint of peat there too. The taste lets it down a wee bit, as the coffee gives it a metallic note. Full bodied and creamy; soft carbonation. Glad to have tried it.

Tap at mikkeller. Pitch black, lace. Big coffee, chocolate, smoke nose. Maybe bacon, maybe just smoke. Great nose. Coffee, bacon, smoke, hops, chocolate, licorice flavors. Very comllex, dry roasty bitter finish with smoke. Rathernlight body. Very nice.

25 cl på fad, 7,4 %, Søernes Ølbar, 27. august. 
Sort olie i glasset med flygtigt moccafarvet skum. 
Aroma af brændte malte, kaffe, lakrids, røg. Smagen er saltet og bitter med lettere surhed i eftersmagen. Røgen fornemmes tydeligt, når man smager. Blød mundsmag med nedtonet kulsyreindhold. Ingen nævneværdig sødme. Lidt for "brændt" til undertegnedes smag. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

35 DKK from Kihosk. 7.5% a motor oil pour with a orange-ish head. Smokey coffee with a hint of bacon. Smooth full mouthfeel with a mostly coffee flavor & possibly a hint of smoke. I am not getting any bacon notes at all so kind of disappointing but it isnt as pronounced as in the regular beer geek breakfast which I like.

Oily pour creating a dark, tan-coloured head slowly fading over a coal black body. Fragile layer of lace to the glassware. Large amounts of sediment to the last pour. A deep sniff reveal a peaty and smoky smell with dark malts behind. The taste character is partially consistent with the aroma bringing grainy chocolate and coffee grounds on a smoked backbone. Dark bitter ending. Velvet in the mouth. Good, however, it did not live up to my expectations

Bottle. Black as night with a tanned head. 
Aroma is very smoked, almost meaty :D You get some of the coffee and roasted characters too. Maybe a slight hint of sweet chocolate - but without a doubt - the thing you remember from this is the smoke and meat feel.
Taste is dominated just as much by smoke and meat flavors. It almost has this sour feel to it due to the intensity from these. Coffee is also present along with roasted characters as well.
Mouthfeel is not that big. A little on the bigger side of medium, and not that dry - rather smooth. I dont really feel the oatmeal, maybe it adds a faded sweetness to it, but not that much.
Nice to finally have tried this. Extremely unique and interesting, but the normal stout flavors are, to me, too faded/not present enough in this beer to get a top grade from me. Solid brew, however but nothing fantastic.

Bottle from Kihoskh enjoyed at home
Pours dark, black in glass, tanned head that falls down quite fast. Smells of coffee, smoke, tar and roasted malts. Moderate sweet, insanely roasty, coffee all over the place, bacon assosiations. Medium bitter finish. Really a beer geak bacon with coffee at breakfast.

Tap @ Mikkeller. Pours black with a light-brown head and thick lacing. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee and smoke. Taste is mostly of the same as the aroma. Yeah, theres smoke in there, but absolutely in no way does it make me think of bacon. Body is on the thin side and the taste is roasty and very metallic. Drinkable but will become a facourite.
Rökta charkuterier i doften. Torr. Lite sträv och rökig. Känner inget som kan liknas vid bacon, vilket var lite av en besvikelse

Tap @ fermentoren, 5/8 2013. Pitch black, medium tan head, great lacing that last. Aroma, roasted malts with a smoked background, coffee, chocolate, .Taste, roasted malts, smoke, licorice, dark bitter chocolate, bitter hops, coffee, . Ends with a long bitter smoky aftertaste.

Tap at Mikkeller. Pours black with a short, creamy white head and thick lacing. Aroma is coffee, smoked pork and cocoa. Flavour is smoky bacon, chocolate, vanilla and espresso. Chewy body, smokiness isn't overwhelming and holds the beer together pretty well, great stout.

Bottle: Literally black, mid-sized loose tanned head,coffee and smoked to toasted malt in the bitter-sweet nose, solid dryish bitter-sweet flavour, full bodied, soft - but some alginate-like jellies found; robust and lingering dry coffeeish (illusions of freshly ground coffee) and fruity finish. O.K., but it doesnt demand a repetition

One of the best stout I had.
Aroma, smoked with coffee. Appearance, black with minimal froth. Taste, not too much smoked (Compliments the coffee flavor in the brew insted of hiding it). Body not too and without much carbonatation. A bit thin on the finish though.
(RT 1)

Know Ive had this before. Guess I didnt rate. Bottle. Black pour with brown head and lots of lacing. Aroma is smoke, sweet malt, wood. Tastes are chocolate, light soy vibe, coffee. Burnt, but not crazy smoke - which is good by me. Perfect milky medium to thick texture. Dry sharp finish. This is a really nice brew where the smoke works along side other flavors instead of dominating.

Pours nearly black with a moderate brown head. Aroma is ashy, salty and peaty with an undercurrent of dark chocolate. Flavor follows with lots of dark chocolate -- down to the tannic aftertaste -- and modest smokiness. Could use more complexity or body midpalate as it feels a bit like washing down dark chocolate with water. Dry and mildly astringent.

Bottle shared with (and great courtesy of) the Bergen tasting crew. The colour is black and has a brown colour. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate, soy sauce, licorice and smoke. Lots of the same in the taste with the addition of ash and oak. The mouth feel is rich but with lumps, and has a lasting medium bitterness. The last part of the beer has a lot of jelly lumps. Not pleasant. Apart from this its a well-balanced and nice beer. A bit more faint smoky tones than expected.

UPDATED: APR 12, 2014 Rerated 12.04.2014, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Nice light brown creamy longlasting head. Aroma is rich and slightly sweet, dark malts, espresso, hops, burnt caramel, licorice, dark chocolate, hints of leather and smoke. Taste is slightly rich, dark roasted malts, hops, espresso, burnt caramel, grass, licorice, dark chocolate, burnt wood, tar, hints of smoke. Medium to longlasting bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Very nice.

May 2011, 0,5l bottle (batch #489) sampled @ first ever BBGTC tasting:
9-5-8-3-16=4,2
Fyldig lukt med preg av mørk malt, humle, kaffi, salt lakris, lær, mørk sjokolade, mørk frukt og litt røyk. Fyldig sødmerik smak med preg av mørkbrent malt, humle, syrlig kaffi, mørk sjokolade, lakris, tjære, brent tre, mørk frukt. God bitterhet som set litt. Veldig god.

500 ml bottle thanks to jtclockwork. Pours a thick, viscous black with a khaki colored head of foam. The aroma has just a pleasant smoke, bacon presence on top of the coffee stout base. Taste is lightly smoky with faint coffee and hearty malt profile. Thick and slick on the tongue. Really a nice smoked beer. Surprisingly drinkable.

Deep black pour with a frothy, brown head.  It has a smokey bacon aroma with wood, dark chocolate, and mild coffee.  The medium body has a creamy texture with soft carbonation.  The taste is well-balanced.  It starts with some sweetness and finishes dry with a little more coffee flavor.

Bottle from Bierkompass!

Pours deep black with deep brown, thick creamy head. Smell is very earthy/smokey, with lots of burnt malts, chocolate and roasted coffee! Starts with sweet chocolate notes, paired with roasted coffe, burnt malts and a slight smokey bacon aroma. The middle part has lots of roasted coffe and chocolate, the bacon gets a little bit stronger. Goes into a very roasted coffeeish finish with sweet chocolate and a slight alcoholic note.

From the looks of this beer it is nicely carbonated, has a foaming brown thin head, and is of a deep black color. The aroma is full of smoke with minor notes of licorice, tobacco, roasted malts, hops, and chocolate. The flavor is of roasted malts, bitter coffee, and grains. The finish is of smoke, malts, grains, and yeast that form a somewhat enjoyable aftertaste. Overall it is a good beverage but a little too corrupted by the smoke that tends to take away from the other ingredients and their flavor.

Bottle from MGM in Burnsville, MN. Nice black pour with a lasting tan head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, tobacco, bacon/grease smokiness. Taste is smoked meat, coffee and chocolate, silky mouth feel, outstanding.

50 cl bottle.

Pours pitch black color with a small beige head. Aroma of licorice, distant smoky notes, tar, coffee notes and some hops, dark chocolate and dark roasted malts. Flavor of roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, some smoke hints and licorice. Complex and very tasty. Excellent.
Pours tar black with a almost brown soapy head.  Aroma of smoke, roasted malt, and coffee.  Creamy body with smoke, roasted malt, coffee, and chocolate with hint of oatmeal.  Very nice beer.

A - Dark black with some brown and a finger of frothy chocolate head. Fades normal.

S - Roasted dark chocolate malts, roasted coffee, bacon and smoked meats, molasses, black licorice, milk chocolate, earthy hops, oatmeal.

T - Dark chocolate malts, roasted coffee, bacon, vanilla, smoke, molasses, black licorice, earthy hops, some bitterness, some milk chocolate, oatmeal.

M - Medium-full bodied with moderate carbonation. Super smooth and a bit creamy with a warming, smokey, and sweet finish.

D - Great overall balance with the bacon flavors.

Dark black with small head and good lacing.  Liquid smoke smell dominates with hints of chocolate and cherry.  Taste same as aroma minus the cherry. Has a salty finish reminiscent of bacon. Semi dry with moderate mouthfeel.  Ok but wouldn't buy again.  Not a fan of smoked beer.

Bottle to snifter.  Pours black with ruby highlights.  Smells like liquid smoke.  Taste is bitter smoke with no discernible bacon flavor.  No coffee or smoothness if oatmeal.  Dry mouthfeel. Don't really care for it.

Very dark a little bit of tan head that dissipates. Powerful liquid smoke smell that dominates. Can't get much else on the nose, burned wood.  Some carbonation and smoked salty with some cherry hidden underneath and the slightest bit of coffee ground. Overall not bad for a smoked brew, but lacks something.

Black, with a ruddy coloured head; aroma of smoked meat; smoky, espresso coffee, thick, peaty; nice charcoal, ashy sensation in the background; like liquid frazzles; lovely, well worth the crazy high price as an annual treat.

50cl bottle,batch no.557,shared with Shaun.
Pours black with thick head.Smokey aroma with cocoa,tar and bacon.In the taste bacon,smoke and chocolate making an ok drink but not one i wlll be trying again any time soon.

500ml bottle from Discount labelled "Rauch Geek Breakfast" on Thanksgiving morning shared with ck1. Pours brown/black with an off-brown head. Nice lacing. Aroma has big meat smoke, with underlying caramel malt and chocolate. Taste is much smoother than the aroma would indicate. Smoke, milk chocolate, bits of bacon, some roasty-ness. Finishes sweet and smoky. Nice, tasty, a bit too smoky.

Bottle from South Bay Drugs: Created a thick formation of fluffy foamed head while the liquid was a jet black used motor oil color. The smell is smokey and has a sweet base of bitter dark chocolate and roast dark malt.  Flavor is robust and rich with a thick smoked taste with a background of roasted coffee bean.
Burnt black bacon (My specialty!) Roasted fat. Ash. Liquid campfire. YumYum Pigs Bum!

Bottle, consumed at home. Pours a syrupy black tone with a trim caramel head. Smells immediately of roast, duck fat, ash, liquorice and booze. Tastes predominately of charcoal, bacon grease, hops and dark chocolate. Ends nice and smoky with an appealing green apple tart note.
Bottle @ Home. Pours black with a brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, light smoke, bacon. Flavor of roasted malt, coffee, light smoke, licorice. Medium body, soft carbonation. 160810

12th November 2010Opaque black beer. Small brown head, short lived. Softish semi dry palate. Dark chocolate malt, tangy. Tiny bit of hop and of course there is a little smoke. Mild minerals in the finish with the tang becoming fruity. Nicely joined up and a nice smoked.

Split a bottle with my wife in our NYC hotel.

This beer appears a deep shade of black, with hints of brown only detectable at the crest when held up to the light. The beige head is surprisingly small and recedes quite rapidly, leaving only faint traces of lacing. The aroma is remarkably similar to the non-smoked version, Beer Geek Breakfast, as the smoky aspect is more subdued than I would have guessed. The beer has a nice flavor, with roasted and burnt malt taking center stage. The smoke flavor is a welcome addition, and integrated nicely. The body is medium-thin. There is noticeable bitterness in the finish from the charred malt that lingers in the tongue between sips. This is a good beer and worth trying. Its a nice variation of the original.

pours black/brown with a very nice creamy foamy head, silky bubbles. Peat, smoke and burnt wood on the nose. Peated scotch up front, burnt wood, silky creamy mouthfeel, thick malts, caramel, vanilla, dark bitter chocolate, good sweetness (6/10), finishes bittersweet. High complexity, high depth, excellent transitions, excellent carry, great drinkability. An A-class beer; only mildly heavy, but nothing to complain about.

Old review. Bottle, pours a deep brown color with thick head and alright lacing. Aromas of stong smoke, cocoa, braised ribs, and peat. Taste is smoked almonds, rich coffee, and some dark chocolate malts. Medium to full bodied smoked beer with an ashy finish. Decent, but I hate pretty much all smoked beers.

(Bottle) Pours black with a large, pale brown head. The aroma holds campfire, tar, cigarette smoke and smoked meat up front with undertones of coffee, asphalt, liquorice, wet soil, wet stone and hints of green hops. The flavor is light sweet, medium bitter and tiny acidic with notes of smoke, meat, coffee, cocoa, asphalt, tar, earth, liquorice, tobacco and  green hops. The mouthfeel is round and soft with a light carbonation. Lingering smoky, roasted and citric finish. Medium bodied.

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2012 500 ml bottle bought @ beer planet.ours oily pitch black with a huge frothy, creamy and bubbly brownish white head that leaves lots of trace and lacing on the glass while dissipating. Smell is sweet with roasted malts, dark chocolate, smoke, dark roast coffee, burnt wood, peat, alcohol, burnt caramel, lemon zest, wet soil, sweet liquorice, single malt whisky and hints of vanilla fudge. Taste is sweet and bitter with roasted malts, smoked ham, peat, earth, bitter chocolate, dark roast coffee, Islay whiskey, lemon zest, pine, burnt wood, alcohol, resin, salty liquorice and hints of cookie dough and caramel. Mouthfeel is smooth, tiny dry, tart and medium bodied. Finish is tiny sweet and bitter with roasted malts, peat, dark roast coffee, smoke, wood, burnt caramel and pine.

Pours black with a deep tanhead. Aroma is so very smokey and bacon-tastic. Chocolate, smoke, bacon in the flavour, not quite as rich as Id like - it seems the smoke cuts through it a little, but generally good.

Bottle:
Pours black with dark tan head.
Scent is heavy, oily smoke.
Taste is burnt chocolate and coffee...fairly mild.
Good, not quite great, but close...
Strangely....no meat to speak of.
Still, I enjoyed it.

Bottle. Chocolate coffee malt aroma. Black brown with a small tan head, gelatinous sediment with stuck to the inside of the glass. Chocolate coffee malt, charred ashy flavor. Medium to full body. Good solid stout, but I suspect some hype. Id take a Bells Java stout over this any day.

Bottle.  Chocolate, coffee, and oatmeal malt aroma.  Brown with small tan head. Sweet lightly smoky charcoal and chocolate malt flavor.  Bitter ashy finish.  Not bad but light and I didnt get any bacon aroma or flavor at all.

bottle from 5 points. Pours near black with a small head. Aroma has a good amount of smoke along with coffee, ashes, cacao, peat and earth. Carbonation is on the light side with an oily palate. Im digging the flavor. Theres a decent amount of smoke, but not as much coffee character as Beer Geek Breakfast. Im getting a faint plastic-like flavor that keeps this beer from being truly perfectly delicious, but it is buried well by the roasty malts, campfire and coffee. Ive been wanting this beer for a long time, and while it is delicious I dont know that it lived up to my hype.

Bottle at breakfast at Trevors bachelors party. Congrats man. Absolutely perfect with our steak and eggs. Great smoked meat nose, peat, earthy. Slight sourness. Warming tartness, same sour over dry porky smoke. Dry bitter finish. Pretty great.

Poured with a breakfast of steak and eggs. Beautiful glossy black pour, with a mocha-colored head. The perfect amount of smoke overlays chocolate and coffee notes. Deep, dark roasted malts dominate, and this one has several layers. Very drinkable -- good carbonation keeping it from being too sticky, and the smoke is present throughout. Super tasty.

Super head, large brownish and filling the glass. Nose is peated smoke like an mild Islay malt with coffee and chokolate. semi full and long. taste of islay with some choko sweetness. soft with only a light elegant bitterness - and of course the dryness from the Islay peat. Very fine but maybe to thew light side for a mikeller ;-)

Aroma: Strong chocolate aroma, alcohol, wood, smoke (a lot of).

Body: Big and creamy

Taste: Very bitter, no hint of sweetness. Espresso coffee and burnt grain. 

Finish: Coffeeish and strong, long bitterness.

Overall: I dont like it very much. Plain bitterness and nothing else. Tried it paired with a chocolate bar too, didnt quite improve things for me.

A - pours thick opaque coffee black with no head. No lacing. S - chalky dirty smoky dark malts. Vanilla bourbon dry oaky and burned toffee. M - dark full bodied stout. Medium palate, low complexity. Lingering smoke. T - dry dirty smoky oak up front. tangy toasted malts, bittersweet chocolate smoke and oatmeal on the palate. Lingering bitter hint of hops, earthy chalky malts. O - nice complex aromas for a Simplistic smoked stout. 7-

Bottle.

Almost black with a nice, tan head. A lot of smoke, salt, chocolate and roasted malt in the aroma. The taste was good but not as heavy as expected. The finish was long, bitter and with a lot of smoke.

50 cl bottle @ home. Pours black with some sediment and a huge mocha head that fades pretty quickly leaving no lacing. Aroma is smoke, peat, salt, chocolate and coffee. Taste is salt, smoke, peat, and bitter chocolate.

50 cl bottle @ home. Batch #489: brewed 11.03.2010, BBE 11.03.2013. Rated on 25.03.2011
Aroma has roasted malt, some coffee and dark chocolate. No signs of smoke. Flavour is smoky and roasted with coffee, dark chocolate, some ash and hints of peat. Basically this is just what it promises to be: BGB with smoke. Excellent stuff, probably best Smoked Ive had

Squid ink pour with a creamy latte head...didnt leave a spot in the glass.  Aroma showed smoky, salty, pork belly, cocoa and brown sugar.  Flavor isnt nearly as bacon-inspired.  Instead, got lots of char, ash, burnt wood, and campfire.  Not a lot else.  Bit of chocolate, touch of toffee, and a slight swirl of caramel.  Invisible ABV...nicely carbonated...with it was a tad chewier.

Bottle, pours deep black with a thick, dark mocha head. The aroma is absolutely terrible, smelling of anti-bacterial Band-Aid and rubber. Thankfully, the taste is not as bad, starting off with a light, smokey bacon followed by malty oatmeal. Average carbonation and medium body. The gag-inducing rubber aroma is just way too much to overcome. I am quite disappointed in this one considering Ive enjoyed several other of the Beer Geek series.

500 ml bottle into snifter, no bottle dating.  Pours an almost pitch black color with a nice 1 finger dense tan head with good retention that reduces to a thin cap that lingers.  Some spotty lacing on the glass.  Aromas of burnt wood, smoked meat, roasted malt, dark chocolate, caramel, and coffee.  Nice and balanced aromas with good strength.  Taste of big dark chocolate, burnt wood, smoke, caramel, roasted malt, coffee, molasses, and herbal hops.  Light bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of chocolate, smoke, caramel, coffee, and roasted malt on the finish for a bit.  Nice balance of flavors without being too smokey.  Medium carbonation and body; with a nice creamy and lush mouthfeel.  Alcohol is well hidden with only a slight warming after the finish present.  Overall this is a very nice smoked stout.  Nice balance and robustness; and very drinkable as well.  Enjoyed this one.

Bottle.Pours a perfect black with a nose of smoke, charred wood, smoke, and more smoke.  Flavor is charred wood with whisps of smoke.  Simple.  Average mouthfeel.  Good, but not great despite the high rating.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text: Smoked, pretzel-like aroma.  Black with nice brown head.  Medium bodied with a smokey character (but not too much) with a chocolatiness.

From notes, reviewed 5/21/11. On tap into tulip. Pours pitch black, two finger billowy brown head, thick lacing. Smell is very smokey almost meaty, malty, raisins, apples. Taste is very meaty/smokey, like Im in the mountains cooking bacon from a freshly slaughtered boar over a fire, some bitter chocolate in the middle meeting with some hoppiness in the finish, espresso lingers on afterwards. Its very smooth and creamy, thick and untamed. Great after dinner or for breakfast. Despite just how smokey it is, its never too much.

I poured a 500ml bottle into a tulip glass.Appearance: By far one of the blackest beers Ive ever seen. So dark this beer seems to eat light. Forms one of the darkest heads Ive ever seen: dark brown froth with tight density. Very good lacing and retention.Smell: The rauchbier component is very prominent in the nose with a lightly smoky, woody, almost permanent marker-like aroma. Bitter dark chocolate and deeply roasted malts are also quite strong - indicating this is going to be a robust stout.Taste: Smoked malts are generally used for lighter ales and lagers, but making a stout out of a rauchbier is unheard of. But then again, brewing unique, eccentric beers is what Mikkeller is known for and the Beer Geek Bacon is a good example of that. The first half of the palate is very traditional in the strong stout style. Sweet with a light chocolate milk/oatmeal taste. Then the beer changes on a dime into a smoky, dry, almost woody flavor. Reminds me of the smell of a carpenters shop of pine or balsa wood being heated. It transitions into a bitter dark chocolate taste - all of which blends very well together. It doesnt really taste like bacon per se, but the smokiness is enough to remind you of breakfast while camping. The aftertaste is of roasted malts and slightly dry, but never obnoxious.Mouthfeel: Thick, but not syrupy or overtly viscous. One of the softest, most comfortable beers I can recall - it nuzzles the tongue and throat all the way down. No alcohol presence whatsoever.Drinkability: The first few swigs of Mikkeller Beer Geek Bacon took some getting used to, but once I did it was smooth sailing all the way. The tasty palate and silky smooth texture combined with almost non-existent carbonation make this beer surprisingly quaffable. Im actually impressed so much could be done with 7.5% ABV and I cant help but think this could be brewed even stronger for more flavor without turning it into a sipper.Overall, this is a very interesting and fun beer to drink. Its a little pricey and hard to find, but I dont think youll be disappointed at all.

I dont smoke, but I do usually like smoked beers a lot. No particular flaws, but better slightly better in the flavor than in the aroma. Very nice.

500mL bottle, split with manuchampions and Matts_Property, pours black with a big brown head. Huge bacon on the nose, with lots of smoke / peat, and roasted malt in the background. Flavour is very smooth - less bacon and smoke than the nose, though lots of smoked malt, peat / campfire qualities, sort of a slight iodine quality (though not in a bad way), some burnt bacon. Basically a stout with lots of smoke. Excellent.

It poured a black color with a thin tan head. The aroma was of roast, smokey meat, earth, and coffee. The flavor was chocolate, coffee, earthy smoky notes, leather, jerky and some coffee notes in there also. The taste of beer and bacon, definitely unique.

Pours a dark black colour with a thick brownish cream head. The aroma is roast malts and strong coffee and smokey colour. Taste is mildly smokey , sweet roasted malt and chard bacon.  a excellent smoked beer

(bottle) pours a deep black colour with a creamy though stable beige head. aroma of toasted malts, char and herbal hops, somewhat ovepowering the subtle hints of brown sugar and biscuit, and with an ashy, almost medicinal smokiness. flavour is less aggressive, the brown sugar and char balance each other out nicely. medium to full-bodied with soft carbonation and a dry, smoky finish.

28/07/2011 50cl bottle @ Klaas place - brewdate: 27/10/10 (2011-353) Thanks to Klaas for sharing the bottle!
Very dark brown to black beer, small beige head, unstable, bit adhesive. Aroma: bit smoky, wood, mocha, some tobacco. Not the most bacon like aroma I ever smelled. That would be a Schlenkerla or something. MF: ok carbon, medium body, oily texture. Taste: sweet caramel start, mocha and dark chocolate, coffee bitterness and a touch of smoke. Aftertaste: smoke, some hops, coffee bitter. Meh.

Bouteille de 500ml. Batch 557, brassée le 27/10/2010. Classique bière noire très foncée avec une mousse brune et durable. Le nez de fumé est bien marqué et présent. Il y a de liode du malt. Une touche grillé tente de percé le mur de fumé de bois de chauffage. Elle est moyenne de corps. la finale est sèche et à la limite de lastringence, les goûts de fumé sont marqués. Les houblons sont amères en fin de bouche. Pas mon style.

Toweringly huge dark brown-beige head, persistent over black-brown beer. Superb smoked-phenolic nose with smoked baconrind, tarred gulfbreakers, rookzout, with indeed something salty, even in the nose. Phenolic, ashy, smoked; sweetish and mineral touches into a mainly bitterish-roasted beer; good balance. Well-bodied, quite slick, creamy head. Another very good Mikkeller Stout. Does he ever make the same beer twice?

Bottle, Batch 557 best before 271013.
Black with a huge dark brown head with a creamy top.
Aroma: large smokiness, peat, chocolate, salt.
Taste: smoke and peat, chocolate, coffee, salty licorice, no bacon flavours, not very meaty at all.
Above medium-bodied, smooth.
A really nice smoky stout.

(Batch 557)  Le liquide est noir.  Le col mousseux qui est large et solide ne laisse que très peu de traces.  Au nez, les malts qui sont extrêmement rôtis, parfois même brûlés et lourdement fumés laissent sexprimer des parfums de chocolat noir et de café fort.  On imagine bien, en sourdine,  les magnifiques effluves de la version régulière.  Le goût rappelle énormément les arômes : outre la fumée, le charbon de bois et les grains torréfiés, le cacao pur accompagne des notes cendrées qui finissent par égratigner gentiment les papilles.  En bouche, le liquide a un corps moyen avec un pétillement doux et une texture huileuse.  La finale est intense de notes amères de torréfaction et de fumée asséchante.  En résumé, très très appréciable.

500ml bottle in a snifter.  Pours black with a thick, lacy, tan head.  Aroma of barbecue smokiness that overpowers all of the goodness of the Beer Geek Breakfast.  I really like the original version of this beer, and even though the smokiness makes it interesting I would rather just have the Beer Geek Breakfast.  Average texture.  A really good beer.

bottle at daks 9/5/10.

thick pour... almost black with a brown head and spotty lace.

aromas of smoky malt, salt, fish food, roast, chocolate, dust and rubber.

it tastes danish...chocolate, roast, ash, rubber and smoke. rauch=yes. bacon=not so much.

medium bodied... rich for a rauch with a light feeling from the dryness and ash. 8/4/7/4/15/+
UPDATED: AUG 16, 2013 Draught. Black with huge beige head. Aroma is hard roast, licorice, smoke, cofffee. Taste is smokey, almost meaty, whipped cream. Soft carb , long smokey licorice finish.

500ml bottle. Black with creamy tan head. Smoke, peat, chocolate, smoked malts, coffee, anise; mild sweet with some bitterness, very well carbonated  and quite creamy; becomes slightly more bitter, and a nice hit at the end along with some roasted malts, smoke, and dryness. Lingering taste of malts, coffee, chocolate and smoke. Favourite smoke beer to date. Quite nice.
Pours dark black with light smoke and chocolate notes.  Deeper notes of smoke and bacon drive during the mouthfeel and give a lasting impressions along with light notes of cocoa and anise.

Big big tan head to match the big smoke and  dead leaves nose. Whopping big smoke with some dates and plum finish. A great big smoky black beer with a nice rauchbier-like finish!! Wow its gonna be tough to recipe this one for a homebrew.

Interesting blend between the coffee and the smoked malts makes for a calcinated meat, peat moss, damp earth, dead leaves and similar flavours. Almost black, its head is tan and enormous. Even the foam translates those odours as the mouth conveys slightly vegetal dark chocolate on top of it. Extremely tasty and exactly the flavours youd expect the concept to deliver. At the same time. not very complex, with almost no fruity complexities, but perhaps they would not really fit the ensemble. While it already does not feel very sweet with all that roast, the intense medium-bubbled carbonation, while not too biting, removes any sugar trace and may diminish the depth, making the focus geared towards roast. Not very diplomatic, but it knows what it wants and its a flavour profile I sometimes feel like having. Solid.

500ml bottle from IPB.

Appearance : Pitch black small brown head. Not much lacing.

Aroma : Meaty smoke with rich roasted malt Light wood with chocolate. Light coffee with hops. Notes of ashes,

Taste : Smoke, roasted malt and lots of ashes. Finish has lots of ashes with some smoked wood. A bit harsh on the finish. Nice roasted malt with light choco and coffee. Finish is quite warm especially for only 7.5% abv.

(16.9oz bottle from Holiday Wine in SD).  Pours dark brown with khaki head.  Aroma is smoke, dark chocolate,  and  some light dark fruit.   Medium bodied with oily texture.  Bitter finish.  Ok beer,  but could use some sweetness.

Let this bottle warm up a bit out of the fridge. Poured with a mammoth, tan, foamy, frothy, thick, creamy head and no lace. Color is an absolutely opaque brown black. Aroma is smoke, dark roasty malt, dark ripe fruit, and old leather. Taste is very similar to nose with just a hint of malt sweet. Body is good, smooth, soft and chewy with good carbonation. Finish is like flavor and of medium length. I prefer smoke beers with a milder smokieness, so I dont call this a session.

Thanks to the kind soul that shared this at the Tampa tasting last night.  Nose is smokey, and I mean smokey as hell, I mean peaty and smokey as hell, I mean in a way that I thought only BrewDog could achieve.  Wow.  This one has boozy bandaid and some roast to it, but the huge smoke notes guard the nose and flavor like Argus at the gates of hell, letting no one escape.

(500ml bottle thanks to bu11zeye) Pours black, smells like smoke, tastes like smoke. Im not sure theres much else to say. Its good smoke, but overwhelming smoke, though I can get some barrel- vanilla and sweet.

Do I taste bacon?  Yea, probably.  It pours thick like motor oil with a 2 1/2 finger head.  It smells like a camp fire.  Wow!  This is one of the best Rauch beers Ive ever tried.  OK, maybe Im bias toward Mikkel brewed beers because of the panache but damn.  This Pt. + 9 bottle went down in minutes.  This is all beef jerky, fire, maybe a bit of vanilla.  Maaaaan, do I love bacon and this is bacon-ish.  Drink this beer!

Shared bottle @ BrewDog Edinburgh. Pours deep black with a large, creamy brown/beige head. Nose is massive woodsmoke, smoky bacon & some oatmeal, a hint of coffee maybe. Dry, burnt toast palate with a subtle hint of nutty/oatmeal sweetness. Finish isnt long, but distinctive with more burnt toast and coffee grounds. I loved this, but this is also one of my favourite styles so Im biased.

Pours pitch-black into the glass, with the deepest of ruby-hued fringes.  The head, of deep chocolate brown, immerses the brew with initial rage, then dissipates, leaving thick spiderweb lacing.  The nose, of chocolates, bacon, smoked peat and tobacco, are comforting... albeit lighter than anticipated.  The flavors are of peat, charred malt, bittersweet chocolate, smoked grains and a hint of pork (bacon noted).  The finish is a charred, smoked hop that is reminiscent of spent tobacco.  The mouthfeel is smooth, with lively CO2 levels that provide zest to the palate.  All-in-all it, it works well as a stout by offering, with many complexities at its disposal.  The "smoked" label is certainly available, yet possibly not the best description of this great brew.

Bottle from Ölbutikken cons 2011-06-01 Gbg
AR: dark bitter chocolate, coffey, smokey wood
AP: dark brown, high frothy dark beige steady wee bubbly head
F: great bitterness, bitter coffey, wee choclate, smokey but yet a bit watery feeling/hollow body, a bit vinos...

Bottle at Brewdog bar, Edinburgh. Pours a very dark brown colour with a thick tan head.Whiskey and malt aroma with very nice smoky bacon and malt flavours and some co2 prickle. Lovely smooth mouthfeel with lingering smoky malt flavours. I prefer the weasel but this is still very nice.

Bottle @ Ölbutikken Copenhagen. Pours pitch black with a tense brown head leaving lace. Aroma is slughtly bacon, smoked, roasted, acidy, fruity. Smokey velvety mouthfeel. Flavor is acidy, smoked, fruity, bitter, daek fruits. Tart palate. Finishes longlived tart bitter.

THOUGHTS: Not bad, but the smoke seemed a little acrid to me. It was less bacon-like and more burning plastic or electrical fire to me. Luckily the great stout flavors were not hurt too much by the off smokiness. Still a decent stout, but not so great of a smoked beer. Hid alcohol fairly well.
TECHNICAL: Bottle. Poured a dark, opaque black with a large, light brown head that mostly diminished, but kept a thick sheet and lft fair to good lacing. The aroma had light to moderate roasted malts, chocolate and coffee; light to moderate pine hops; smoked gouda; smoke: tar; burnt plastic; electrical fire and a little smoked meat. The initial flavor was light to somewhat sweet and lightly bitter; while the finish was somewhat to moderately sweet and moderately bitter with a long duration. There was chocolate, roasted malt, smoke, slight hops, oat, coffee, slight burnt plastic or electrical fire, a little caramel, and slight smoked meat and cheese (like smoke gouda). The medium to full body was a little syrupy, but fairly oily and a bit creamy, too. It also had lightly fizzy carbonation and a lightly acrid and slightly alcoholic finish.

33cl bottle @ Brewdog Bar in Edinburgh. Pours an opaque black with a cappuccino head. The nose has bacon and smoked cheese. The taste has a gorgeous smoked malt and creamy peatiness (if that makes sense). The palate is big in structure, with a thick creamy texture and it cleans fairly well at the end. Overall, this is a great balance between smokiness and creaminess.

head: thick, large , coffee head colour 
colour:  dark brown to black 
smell: alcohol, chocolat, nosetingling bitterness and some sournes, smoked and very roasted malts,  bit of coffee 
taste: very smokey and chocolaty start , quite bitter background , notes of wood chips , ashes , metallic , malts , end is tingling , semi dry with a oily texture , aftertatse is earhty and coffee , pretty good
Tap at Farmers Cabinet.   Dark brown with small tan head.  Lots of smoke, ash, tar, caramel.  Very little bacon.  A solid smoked beer though.

Bottle from Bacchanalia, Cambridge, 3rd June consumed 9th June 2011   Pours black, shark eye black with billowing tan head. Roasty with some smouldering elastoplast. Soft in the mouth, the smokiness is less bacon than I would have liked though rather pleasingly it is also less elastoplast also and in fact on that front it is a better beer than I imagined it would be. I can even get a rich velvety chocolateyness which is not in the least bit overawed by the smokiness. Some burnt toast and coffee. Good stuff.   A6 A5 T7 P4 Ov15  3.7

Bottle. Oily near black pour with a lively thick medium brown head. Aroma is smoky, like charred wood but not reminiscent of bacon for me. There is underlying chocolate and sweetness too. Flavour is heavy on the roast, with a dominant smoke element. Again, not at all bringing bacon to mind. Rather, this is like burnt coffee beans or coffee beans rolled in burnt leaves or something. Quite acrid really, with huge bitterness imparted from the burnt malt. Hops are most noticeable in the after-burps. Thankfully the base beer is good enough to rescue this from failure, but I must say that the Bamberg rauchbiers are WAAAYYY more reminiscent of bacon in their smoky character. Still tasty and very smoky, just not bacony, which leaves me a little disappointed.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Black with a large brown head. Aroma is smoke, caramel, coffee, little fruits. Medium body with soft carbonation. Flavours are chocolate, caramel, a bit of smoke, and fruity.

Deep black with a thick tan head. Aroma is strong smoke, reminiscent of a barbecue pit. Really reminds me of sitting outside by the smoker at my favorite BBQ joint. Flavor is huge smoke, almost overwhelming until it turns slightly sweet at the end. I can see why they called this Beer Geek Bacon (my bottle said Rauch Geek Breakfast), the flavor reminds me a little of really smoky bacon that has been cooked a little longer than necessary. But what would be a burnt flavor for bacon works to this beers favor. My only complaint is that the body is a little thin, but the huge flavor largely makes up for it. Hard to pair with food, this seems like something to drink after dinner, even smoked meat could be overwhelmed by it. Overall, excellent beer and quite unique, one of the better and stronger flavored smoked beers Ive had. While not something I would pick up regularly, its definitely something worth experiencing.
Aroma of cured meats and plastics.  Pours a nice dark roasted color with a brown lace.  Tastes like smoked charcoal.  Still not on board with smokebeers but this is neat.
At farmers cabinet with eli.  Not overly bacony as it is waxy and peaty.   Taste like aged in a lagaluvin scotch barrel. Lol I have to agree it does smell like bandaids and iodine.
Bottle from Brewdog webshop. Black colour, tan head. Nose is smoke, peaty, coffee and roasted malts. Flavour is roasted malts, coffee, peat. Indeed smells of band-aid and iodine. Heavily carbonated.

Bottled 500ml (Beer Planet, batch #489, brygget 110310)
Opaque black color, small steady and creamy brown head. Aroma of smoke, black coffee and pipe tobacco. Medium to full-bodied. Lots of tobacco in the flavor, coffee beans, peat, black coffee and ash. Coffee gives a bit unbalanced to this otherwise good brew ... fortunately not vegetably notes as often it does. Slightly too burnt and ashy for my liking.

Pours black like oil, huge warm, medium-brown head (due to bad pour in part) Aroma of salty smoke and slight astringent roast.  Flavor salty smoke up front and lingering with a clean and distinct bitterness and some slighter dry roast and dark chocolate.  Light bodied for a 7.5 abv oatmeal stout.  Not as good as other benchmark smoked beers in my opinion, particularly rauchbocks.

" Rauch Geek Breakfast"
Pours black with a tan head.  Aroma is smoke, rich peat, chocolate.  Creamy mouth feel.   Flavor is chocolate, burnt wood, smoke, peat, some meatiness, campfire.  Not as pungently smoky as some, but nicely balanced - tasty

This poured a straight black color with a beige head. Aroma was lots of smoke, dark roasted malt, and light dark chocolate too. Flavor was just straight campfire and smoked meats, not burnt rubber tastes which is present in some smoked beers. Excellent stuff.
500 ml bottle.  Looks fantastic, smells and tastes like a box of band aids.  Yuk.

Bottle, fresh batch.  Labeled as "Rauch Geek Breakfast".  Served at cellar temperature.
Pours black with a large four finger brown head that holds up very well, eventually recedes to a good cap and leaves sheets of lacing behind.

Aroma is pretty intense smoke, a lot of ham, bacon and meat as well as a strong peat and campfire/charred wood/charcoal presence.  Even a bit of tire smoke from a burnout.  Interesting.  The smoke ultimately hides any of the coffee, chocolate, and roasted malt characteristics of the base beer.  Very good to excellent strength.

Flavor pretty much mirrors the nose, smoked meats, peat, campfire, charcoal and a hint of tire smoke.  The coffee and chocolate are more pronounced in the flavor, coming along in the finish, but the smoke still dominates.

Mouthfeel is medium-plus, creamy and smooth, medium, sometimes prickly carbonation.

Ive been venturing further into smoked beers and this one certainly doesnt disappoint in that aspect and is a unique take on the Beer Geek family.  However, the tire burnout aroma and taste are a bit off-putting but luckily it is a minor aspect of an otherwise fantastic brew.

16.9oz bottle labeled "Rauch Geek Breakfast," shared with Photog.  Pours dark, dark brown, black in the glass, with a 2-finger dark brown head that recedes slowly.  The aromas are roasty chocolate malt, bittersweet cocoa, toffee and slight coffee, with smoked pork and salty bacon.  The flavor is subtle smoke and salted bacon on the front end (I swear, Im getting the lightest note of mint in there somewhere as well), with smoke becoming more pronounced through the middle.  This leads to bitter cocoa and caramel, red berry, and a charcoal/burnt meat finish.  Creamy, low carbonation, medium to full body, and dry.  Very tasty, I wish I had had some bacon and eggs with this.  [716]

The aroma is smoke, roast cofee, dark chocolate.  The smoke doesnt overpower thankfully.   The appearance is a nice deep black, medium brown/tan head.  Decent lacing on glass.  The flavor is smoky, meaty, salty, roast coffee.  Less sweetness than expected.  The finish is smoke, roasty, pine hops.  medium to medium/thick in body.  Very good.  Not worth the $12 for the bottle, but good.

Bottle from the Brewdog online beer shop. Black pour with a thick tan head. Smoke, coffee, dark chocolate and brown sugar aromas. Oaky flavours of chocolate, dark roast coffee and a little smoke. Nicely balanced. Dry, smoky-roast finish.
Black pour with big beige head.  Aroma of strong coffee and dark chocolate with smoke.  Flavor matches aroma with a little licorice.
